alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd; Harrison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 4:22PM EDT until June 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON...SOUTH CENTRAL CLARK...SOUTHERN FLOYD... SOUTHEASTERN MEADE AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 421 PM EDT, the leading edge of strong gusty winds from severe thunderstorms was from near Jeffersonville to Shively to 8 miles west of Valley Station to 8 miles south of Brandenburg, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Louisville, Jeffersonville, New Albany, Shively, Brandenburg, Glenview, Pleasure Ridge Park, and St. Dennis. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
